en: Presentation of San Sebastian 2016, European Capital of Culture
An event to present European Capital of Culture 2016, San Sebastian, Spain, will be held in Brussels on 12 November 2015.
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
An event to present European Capital of Culture 2016, San Sebastian, Spain, will be held in Brussels on 12 November 2015.

San Sebastian holds the European Capital of Culture 2016. It will be an important year not only for those who live or coexist in the city and the region, but also for those regions in Europe and outside its frontiers that share a violent past and are working hard on building a peaceful and respectful society.

With the motto 'Culture for coexistence', DSS2016EU has the ambitious and challenging aim of improving coexistence through culture and creating a unique precedent in Europe. DSS2016EU is an innovative and unique project, whose most important results could only be measured in the long term.

With just two months left beforefor becoming European Capital of Culture and following the publication of the official programme on 30 October 2015, the General Director of DSS2016EU and the Mayor of San Sebastian invite you to attend the presentation event of DSS2016EU in Brussels and a networking cocktail.

In collaboration with the European Commission and the Center for Fine Arts BOZAR, DSS2016EU programme activities will be presented on November 12 at 11:00 am at the Center for Fine Arts BOZAR, Rue Ravenstein 23, Brussels 1000.

Agenda

Michel Magnier, Director of Culture and Creativity at the European Commission´s DG Education and Culture

11:15 - 11:20

11:20 - 12:00

Pablo Berástegui, General Director / Xabier Paya, Cultural Programme Director

12:00
Wrap up

A cocktail will be served at 12:00 pm.

Registration

If you would like to attend, please confirm by email.
